Detailed Description

class C4DView: displays and manipulates four-dimensional Function in a QGLWidget
This class is much too big and will be split into parts wherever possible
Author:
Helge Preuss <scout@hyperspace-travel.de>

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

C4DView::C4DView ( QWidget *  parent = 0  ) 

C4DView constructor; does a lot of initialization to (usually sensible) hardcoded default values, initializes the coordinate cross object (which could well be a class on its own), creates the necessary timers and menus, and finally creates a Hypercube as the default object to display

Parameters:
parent parent QWidget, defaults to NULL

C4DView::~C4DView (  )  [virtual]

C4DView destructor; frees arrays

Member Function Documentation

void C4DView::paintEvent ( QPaintEvent *   )  [virtual]

paintEvent()

void C4DView::initializeGL ( void   )  [virtual]

OpenGL initialization now this is not as boring as it seems, because further work has to be done here: trying to check for rendering to file, but this doesn't work yet. the rest of interesting inits is done in XQGLWidget::initializeGL (), btw.

Reimplemented from XQGLWidget.

approximate diameter of definition space

wrapper for redraw handler, with an exit strategy

void C4DView::Transform ( double  thetaxy,
double  thetaxz,
double  thetaxw,
double  thetayz,
double  thetayw,
double  thetazw,
double  tx,
double  ty,
double  tz,
double  tw 
)

application of translations and rotations calls F->Transform () and transforms the coordinate cross

Parameters:
thetaxy rotation around xy plane (z axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetaxz rotation around xz plane (y axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetaxw rotation around xw plane
thetayz rotation around xy plane (x axis); ignored because 3D rotation takes care of it
thetayw rotation around yw plane
thetazw rotation around zw plane
tx translation in x direction
ty translation in y direction
tz translation in z direction
tw translation in w direction

void C4DView::ApplyChanges ( void   )  [slot]

called whenever an object or the parameters have changed; sets the parameters, applies the changed parameters to the function object and redraws it

projects F and coordinate cross into three-space

void C4DView::PreRedraw (  )  [protected]

separated the 4d projection stuff from the 3d opengl handling into this function

QPixmap C4DView::makePixmap (  )  [protected]

make a pixmap to to be rendered by the gl widget, and render it. this is an embarrassing workaround to make rendering to files work. QGLWidget's renderPixmap() method only produces black frames. Work with QPixmap::grabWindow() instead.

void C4DView::DrawCoordinates ( void   )  [protected]

draw the coordinate cross (on screen or int GL list)

err well.. just that! starts AnimationTimer, too...

void C4DView::StopAnimation (  )  [protected]

you guessed it

void C4DView::RandomAnimation (  )  [protected]

starts a random animation, whose xw/yw/zw rotation speed changes every HARDCODED - EEEEYUARGH! 10 seconds

void C4DView::UpdateStatus ( QString  status = ""  )  [protected]

display some info about current object and its transformations in a status bar. side effect: checks rotation values for overflow and resets them to the interval [-360, 360]. is this wise?

Parameters:
status string to be displayed

void C4DView::AssignValues ( Function *  F  )  [protected]

called whenever an object or the parameters have changed; changes the display on the status bar and the number and names of the parameters and grid parameters on the ValuesDialog

Parameters:
F the Function object for which the ValuesDialog is changed

void C4DView::mouseMoveEvent ( QMouseEvent *  e  )  [protected, virtual]

mouse move event handler; awfully long, which is UGLY, but it does not seem to make much sense to break it up, so here we go particular mouse move/button/modifier key combinations documented below

void C4DView::mouseDoubleClickEvent ( QMouseEvent *  e  )  [protected, virtual]

void C4DView::OnTimer (  )  [protected, slot]

timer event handler updates values if in the middle of an animation, and renders an image tries to write image to file too, if wanted, but fails miserably.
